enb_long_title: Sixth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
section_title: OPENING STATEMENTS AND ELECTION OF COP-6 PRESIDENT
sentences: Jan Szyszko, President of COP-5, opened COP-6, stating that it was possible to reach agreement and ensure that the Protocol entered into effect before the end of 2002, but that many difficult issues had still to be resolved.

He expressed his gratitude to those who had provided assistance during his presidency. Jan Pronk, Minister of Housing, Spatial Planning and Environment of the Netherlands, was elected President of COP-6.

He reaffirmed his commitment to ensuring that the interests of all delegations will be served by the UNFCCC. UNFCCC Executive Secretary Michael Zammit Cutajar drew attention to the evidence presented by Robert Watson, and underscored that action to deal with climate change cannot be delayed.
He said developing countries should feel supported in their efforts to address climate change and its impacts, and all Parties should consider the Protocol to be ratifiable.

He said substantive results should be reached during the first week of COP-6 so political agreements could be sealed by mid-next week, allowing technical drafting to take place before close of the meeting.
